metadata.titleEn: SR Nd isotopic test data of granite in eastern Tibet
metadata.description: We have studied the Petrotectonic attributes of granites distributed in a large area in the North Lancangjiang structure in Bitu area. The major and trace elements and Sr Nd isotopes have been completed in the Key Laboratory of deposit geochemistry, Institute of geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences. Among them, the main elements are analyzed by pw4400 X-ray fluorescence instrument, and the contents of 10 element oxides are determined; Trace elements are tested by ICP-MS inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer. ICP-MS is manufactured by Agilent company in Tokyo, Japan, and the model is Agilent 7700x. The analysis method is the same as that of Zhang Xin, etc. According to the analysis results of standard sample gbpc-1de, the analysis error is less than 5%. MC-ICP-MS double focusing magnetic mass spectrometer with Neptune plus model is used for isotope test experiment. The test basis is GB / T 17672-1999.
metadata.instructions: Sr Nd isotopic data of granites in eastern Tibet docx

Causal Antecedent.Question: What are the causes that lead to measurement errors when using the ICP-MS technique for analyzing trace elements in granite samples?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: Measurement errors in analyzing trace elements using the ICP-MS technique may arise from the calibration of the instrument, as the Agilent 7700x model requires precise calibration to ensure accuracy. Additionally, the sample preparation process and the quality of the standard samples like GBPC-1 could influence the accuracy, as any deviation in these steps might result in errors. The analysis method, as referenced by Zhang Xin et al., may also contribute to errors if not meticulously followed.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective behind collecting Sr-Nd isotope data and major and trace element information for granites in the northern Lancangjiang tectonic zone in the Bitu area?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The goal is to study the structural attributes of granites in the region, which involves conducting comprehensive analyses of major and trace elements and Sr-Nd isotopes to better understand the geological and geochemical characteristics of the granites.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are employed to ensure the accuracy and precision of Sr-Nd isotope data when using the MC-ICP-MS double focusing magnetic mass spectrometer in geological research?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedures to ensure accuracy and precision include using the Neptune Plus MC-ICP-MS double focusing magnetic mass spectrometer, adhering to the standard testing protocol GB/T 17672-1999, and verifying results against standard samples like GBPC-1de, with an analysis error margin of less than 5%.
